name: Elemental Suite

secondaryVideos.caption: FLASH WARNING!! at 6:00 glitching imagery begins Projection art for Morphogenesis from the Elemental Suite by Duo Cichorium

shortDesc: An epic multimedia extravaganza paying tribute to the four elements of nature
desc:
A four-movement music, art, and electronic extravaganza co-composed by Jaz Tsui and Louis Pino. Each movement utilizes customized electronic systems corresponding to a respective element of matter.
Matchbox Ritual is a cyclical ritual between states of peace and chaos completed by two performers, both completing and beginning their journeys while briefly meeting in the middle. 
Morphogenesis features a handmade tree sculpture with custom projection art using OBS-based mapping; the sound and visuals reflect a sunset, a night storm, followed by the breaking of dawn. 
Desiderium uses DIY hydrophones, capturing the sounds of water and instruments within it; sounds are processed in Ableton Live, creating a soundscape that explores island caves, a vibrant shore, and the depths of the ocean. 
Scintillation combines the MUGIC motion sensor, Arduino, and Max, to allow the performers to control the wind (electronic fans) to activate several sets of windchimes â€” an aleatoric soundscape evoking a spring day in a breezy field.

name: Letter Piece #1
desc: Composed by Matthew Shlomowitz; For performer and musician
shortDesc: Composed by Matthew Shlomowitz; For physical performer and musician

name: Anticommunication

shortDesc: Composed by Jet Kye Chong for two speaking percussionists

name: 0 Damage Any % Reverse Glitch Speed Run
desc: This piece invites audience members to play a live game of Super Smash Bros. 64. Button input from the players is captured and analyzed by Max to manipulate aspects of the electronic sound. The percussionists are each assigned a character to sonically represent in performance, creating a unified ensemble between the game players, percussionists, and electronics, all driven by gameplay.
shortDesc: Audience members play a live game of Super Smash Bros. 64, with their button inputs controlling the musical electronics

name: Feedback Dreams
desc: Feedback Dreams is a structured improvisation using no-input mixer, percussion, melodica, and music box. The internal feedback loop of the no-input is seeded and controlled by Jaz's playing and sent out through a delay pedal.
shortDesc: for no-input mixer, percussion, melodica, and music box

name: Noise Ritual
desc: Composed by Nolan Hildebrand; For percussionists and no-input mixer
shortDesc: Composed by Nolan Hildebrand; For percussionists and no-input mixer
